title: An integrated offshore network could save consumers £6bn but risks remain
lead: ​An integrated approach to offshore project from 2025 could save £6 billion for consumers, according to a new report by National Grid ESO.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Zap-Map warns EV industry to ‘sit up and take notice’ of lack of accessibility for disabled drivers
lead: ​A new survey from Zap-Map in collaboration with Motability has found that a third of disabled drivers have difficulties locating a suitable charger that could meet their needs.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Good Energy signs three e-mobility partnerships as new EV tariff unveiled
lead: ​Good Energy is to launch a new time of use tariff for electric vehicle (EV) drivers, having also signed three new e-mobility partnerships.
author: Alice Grundy

title: SSEN calls on customers to ‘signpost’ interest in flexibility services
lead: ​Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (SSEN) has called on generators to “signpost” their interest in providing 250MWs of flexibility to the energy system.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ofgem lays out RIIO-ED2 priorities as it aims for a 'modern, smarter, digitally enabled grid'
lead: ​Ofgem has confirmed its methodology for setting the RIIO-ED2 price controls, focusing on data sharing, flexibility and forward planning.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Belfast unveils climate plans as Manchester joins Race to Zero campaign
lead: ​Belfast and Manchester have both revealed climate change plans, with the latter targeting a 2038 net zero target.
author: Alice Grundy

title: EDF fined £6m for sending ‘false or misleading signals’ to National Grid ESO
lead: ​EDF has agreed to pay Ofgem £6 million for breaching its electricity generation license, having regularly sent misleading signals to National Grid Electricity System Operator (ESO).
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Drax to focus on BECCS following £193.3m sale of CCGTs
lead: ​Drax has sold on Drax Generation Enterprise to VPI Holdings, passing on its four CCGT plants in the process.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Second lockdown 'potentially impacted' smart meter installations as November sees 7% drop
lead: Lockdown may have impacted smart meter installations during England’s second lockdown, according to data from Electralink.
author: Edith Hancock

title: NewMotion seals Fiat Chrysler deal to provide EV charging services across 12 countries
lead: ​NewMotion has secured a new partnership with Fiat Chrysler Automobile’s (FCA) to provide its business customers with electric vehicle (EV) charging services across 12 countries.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Current±​ Chats: ENA's Randolph Brazier on the importance of data for transport electrification
lead: Current±​ caught up with the ENA's head of innovation and development Randolph Brazier to discuss the importance of data in the electrification of transport, visibility of EV chargers and the need for the government's Rapid Charging Fund.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Reactive Technologies forms strategic partnership with Accenture following investment
lead: ​Reactive Technologies has received an investment from global professional services firm Accenture to help accelerate the commercialisation of grid data for utilities.
author: Alice Grundy

title: National Grid launches ‘first of its kind' coordinated system to increase renewable energy connections
lead: ​National Grid ESO, National Grid Electricity Transmission and UK Power Networks (UKPN) have launched a new system to enable increased renewable energy connections through greater network visibility.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Energy white paper broadly welcomed by industry as 'vital piece of net zero jigsaw'
lead: The energy industry has its say on the government's energy white paper, which was released yesterday and details its decarbonisation plans.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Energy white paper: Modelling suggests wind and solar generation could quadruple by 2050
lead: ​Modelling as part of the government’s long-awaited energy white paper shows that wind and solar generation could more than quadruple by 2050.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Current± Predicts: The energy transition in 2021, part two
lead: Part two of the Current± Predicts series sees Invinity's ​Ed Porter and Landis+Gyr's Simon Egan and Nick Merricks comment on what how they think the energy sector will change in 2021.
author: Current± Staff

title: Energy white paper: Offshore wind, CCS and modernising data take centre stage
lead: ​The government’s energy white paper has today been published, detailing its decarbonisation plans across the entire economy.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Piclo to take ‘next big step forward’ with £1.5m Clean Growth Fund investment
lead: ​The first investment from the government’s Clean Growth Fund has been secured by Piclo to help fund its UK and international growth.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Faster, fairer, greener: SWARCO eVolt’s Justin Meyer takes a look at the NIS and EVs
lead: What does the new National Infrastructure Strategy really mean for EV charging? SWARCO eVolt’s Justin Meyer takes a look at the key document.
author: Justin Meyer

title: ENA sets out plan for networks to help ‘supercharge’ decarbonisation following Ten Point Plan
lead: ​The Energy Networks Association (ENA) has released its own Ten Point Plan, highlighting the role of networks in supporting offshore wind, electric vehicles (EV) and hydrogen.
author: Molly Lempriere
